https://hbr.org/2024/11/research-how-gen.title: Research: How Gen AI Is Already Impacting the Labor Market

claims.claim: Gen AI is transforming many industries
claims.quote: Today, advances in gen AI and natural language processing, such as ChatGPT, are transforming many industries and raising similar concerns.

claims.claim: Gen AI has the potential to impact all job sectors
claims.quote: However, unlike past automation technologies, gen AI has the unique potential to impact all job sectors, particularly given its fundamental ability to improve its capabilities over time — which promises to affect the workforce in ways that go beyond simple job replacement.

claims.claim: Gen AI can improve its capabilities over time
claims.quote: particularly given its fundamental ability to improve its capabilities over time — which promises to affect the workforce in ways that go beyond simple job replacement.

claims.claim: AI will replace jobs on a large scale
claims.quote: 77% of respondents were “concerned” that AI will cause job loss within the next 12 months, with 44% “very concerned”

claims.claim: AI will enhance roles rather than replace them
claims.quote: 85% of office workers believe AI will help to enhance their roles rather than replace them

claims.claim: Demonstrating AI skills can help employees retain their jobs
claims.quote: 83% of companies say demonstrating AI skills can help employees retain their jobs

https://budgetlab.yale.edu/research/eval.title: Evaluating the Impact of AI on the Labor Market: Current State of Affairs | The Budget Lab at Yale

claims.claim: The occupational mix has changed more quickly since the introduction of AI, but not markedly so.
claims.quote: The job mix for AI appears to be changing faster than it has in the past, although not markedly so.

claims.claim: The current changes in the occupational mix are not necessarily attributable to AI.
claims.quote: In fact, taking a closer look at recent years, the data suggests that this recent trend is not necessarily attributable to AI

claims.claim: The effects of new technologies, including AI, are evolving and may take longer than expected to materialize.
claims.quote: Historically, widespread technological disruption in workplaces tends to occur over decades, rather than months or years.

https://www.dallasfed.org/research/econo.title: Will AI replace your job? Perhaps not in the next decade - Dallasfed.org

claims.claim: Remote work does not affect productivity
claims.quote: The ultimate effects of AI on the workforce will depend on the extent to which AI augments (or complements) rather than automates (or substitutes for) workers’ tasks.

claims.claim: AI will replace jobs in the next decade
claims.quote: Will AI replace your job? Perhaps not in the next decade

claims.claim: Computerization and AI threaten different jobs
claims.quote: Comparing the occupations thought to be most likely to be computerized a decade ago with those most likely to be automated by AI today, the lists vastly differ (apart from telemarketers)

https://www.nu.edu/blog/ai-job-statistic.title: 59 AI Job Statistics: Future of U.S. Jobs | National University

claims.quote: NU proudly serves active duty and Veteran students from all branches of the military — at home, on base, and abroad

claims.claim: Remote work can increase productivity
claims.quote: AI has the potential to bring about numerous positive changes in society, including enhanced productivity

claims.claim: AI will create new jobs
claims.quote: AI will be taking some jobs, but it will be creating new ones!

claims.claim: AI can improve work-life balance
claims.quote: AI-powered technologies can also help solve complex problems and make our daily lives easier and more convenient

claims.claim: Remote work reduces costs associated with maintaining an office
claims.quote: Proponents of having a geographically distributed workforce argue that it reduces costs associated with maintaining an office

claims.claim: Remote work improves motivation and job satisfaction
claims.quote: grants employees autonomy and flexibility that improves their motivation and job satisfaction

claims.claim: Remote work allows for a more geographically diverse pool of applicants
claims.quote: allows employers to draw from a more geographically diverse pool of applicants

claims.quote: The complete guide to asynchronous and non-linear working

claims.claim: Remote work requires a handbook-first approach to communication
claims.quote: The importance of a handbook-first approach to communication

claims.claim: Remote work is perceived as very positive
claims.quote: Ninety-eight percent of respondents would like to work remotely, at least some of the time, for the rest of their careers

claims.claim: Flexibility is the top benefit of remote work
claims.quote: 22 percent say the biggest benefit to remote work is flexibility in how they spend their time

claims.claim: Remote workers struggle with staying home too often and loneliness

https://www.pewresearch.org/social-trend.title: How Americans View Their Jobs | Pew Research Center

claims.claim: About a third of U.S. workers who can work from home now do so all the time
claims.quote: About a third of U.S. workers who can work from home now do so all the time

claims.claim: Older workers are more likely to be satisfied with their job overall
claims.quote: Two-thirds of workers ages 65 and older say they are extremely or very satisfied with their job overall, compared with 55% of those 50 to 64, 51% of those 30 to 49, and 44% of those 18 to 29

claims.claim: Workers with higher incomes are more likely to be satisfied with their job benefits and opportunities
claims.quote: Workers with higher incomes are more likely than those with lower and middle incomes to say they are extremely or very satisfied with their job overall and to say the same about the benefits their employer provides, their opportunities for training and to develop new skills, how much they are paid, and their opportunities for promotion

claims.claim: Remote work improves work-life balance and reduces burnout
claims.quote: 78% of respondents, reported that working from home at least three days a week improved their work-life balance and reduced burnout

claims.claim: Remote work boosts focused productivity
claims.quote: a 12% increase in overall code commits and ticket resolutions on the days employees work remotely, suggesting a boost in focused productivity

claims.claim: Remote work can lead to feelings of disconnection from company culture
claims.quote: 45% of new hires reported feeling disconnected from the company culture
